commands.title: Create Unreal clangd project (cfg files and settings)

markdownEnumDescriptions: Uses your project's native Intellisense files
unreal-clangd.IntellisenseType.description: Which Intellisense files to use for your project.

unreal-clangd.native.code-workspaceFileB.markdownDescription:
Any setting you want backed up when running the Native "Update Intellisense Files" command.
Running this `Unreal Build Tool's` command refreshes your project causing the project's `*.code-workspace` file to be overwritten.
 These settings will automatically be backed up: `clangd.arguments`, `clangd.path`, `clangd.detectExtensionConflicts`, `files.associations`, `workbench.colorCustomizations`, `editor.suggestFontSize`, `dotnet.defaultSolution`
* `note:` Do not set in a config that Unreal overwrites!

unreal-clangd.native.minutesTillIntellis.markdownDescription:
Minutes till intellisense files are considered old.
* Doesn't affect manually running `Update Compile Commands` command.
* When adding multiple Source files the 'auto-detect and run' `Update Compile Commands` command might not run so run command manually.

unreal-clangd.fixes.intellisenseFiles.description: Fixes Intellisense files when they have errors or need changes.

unreal-clangd.fixes.delegateFuncCompleti.markdownDescription: Some delegate func completion names start with `__Internal_*`. These are `real functions`! When `true`, the proper function macro will be used with the completion instead of the `wrong` macro expansion version.

unreal-clangd.fixes.autoIncludeSourceOnl.markdownDescription: Enable to make 'auto includes' only work on source files, not headers.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Quiet and doesn't require Microsoft C# extension
Shows what Unreal Build Tool is doing. `(requires Microsoft C# extension)`
unreal-clangd.compileCommands.execType.description: How updating compile commands will be run

unreal-clangd.compileCommands.architectu.markdownDescription: For **Mac M1/M2** users this should be **arm64** `(Most users can leave this blank)`

enumDescriptions: Will create anything not created yet (files or settings)
unreal-clangd.creation.overwrite.markdownDescription: This setting doesn't need to be set manually. It will be set during creation process.

unreal-clangd.creation.tidy.markdownDescription: Enables/Disables clang tidy `Read github Clang Tidy section before enabling!`

unreal-clangd.creation.compilerPath.markdownDescription: `Not needed for most people.` See docs on why you would want to use this. Must use `same` compiler version as `clangd`. Windows uses clang-cl.exe and others use clang++

unreal-clangd.creation.bypassUnrealVersi.markdownDescription: `Warning: Older Unreal versions will not work with this extension! This is for future version testing only.`

unreal-clangd.utility.checkForIntellisen.markdownDescription: On startup, it will ask you to update compile commands if it doesn't find Intellisense files. `Do not set until after successfully creating extension project!`

markdownEnumDescriptions: Also triggers on functions with default parameters and empty params`(see doc for side effects)`
Only triggers on functions that are guaranteed to need it
unreal-clangd.editor.parameterHints.description: Auto trigger parameter hints for functions

unreal-clangd.creation.completionHelper.description: Adds Unreal symbols to code completion. Creates a completionHelper.cpp and adds it to compile_commands.json

unreal-clangd.creation.completionHelperM.description: Adds UnrealNetwork.h(multiplayer symbols) to completionHelper.cpp for use in code completion

unreal-clangd.completion.openCompletionH.markdownDescription: Opens `completionHelper.cpp` on startup. Code completion symbols, like macros, don't seem to fully load. This 'hack' seems to work. `Must wait for clangd to fully process completionHelper.cpp before switching to another file`

unreal-clangd.completion.completionHelpe.markdownDescription: `Info window` pops up on startup and explains about completionHelper.cpp
